intro: Erodendrum bombycinum, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal dunes and scrub habitats. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Erodendrum bombycinum is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
